archetype_name: Family Low-Sodium American & French Comfort (30–60, Mild)
name: Herbed Chicken Pot Pie with Puff Pastry Top
description: Comforting chicken and vegetable filling in a light herb cream sauce, baked under a golden puff pastry lid. Seasoned with herbs and pepper to keep sodium in check.
prep_steps: Dice chicken thighs into 1-inch pieces; pat dry.
Peel and dice potatoes into 1/2-inch cubes.
Dice onion; slice celery; peel and dice carrots.
Chop parsley; strip thyme leaves from stems.
Unfold puff pastry and keep chilled; if needed, roll to fit a 9–10 inch oven-safe skillet or casserole.
Have a small amount of milk ready for brushing the pastry.
cook_steps: Heat a large oven-safe skillet over medium heat; add olive oil and 1 tbsp butter.
Sear chicken thighs until lightly browned, 4–5 minutes; transfer to a bowl.
Add remaining 1 tbsp butter to the skillet; sauté onion, celery, and carrots until starting to soften, 4–5 minutes.
Stir in potatoes; cook 2 minutes. Sprinkle flour over vegetables; stir 1 minute to form a roux.
Gradually whisk in vegetable stock, then milk, stirring until smooth. Simmer 3–4 minutes until lightly thickened.

Return chicken and any juices to the skillet. Add peas, thyme, parsley, and black pepper. Simmer 3–4 minutes until the potatoes are just tender. Adjust consistency with a splash of water if too thick.
Remove from heat. Lay puff pastry over the skillet, tucking edges. Cut 3–4 small slits for steam. Brush top with a little milk.
Bake at 400°F (200°C) until pastry is puffed and deep golden and filling is bubbling at the edges, 20–25 minutes.
Rest 5 minutes before serving. Spoon into bowls.
